intro: Phaca megacarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces large, woody fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with ray florets. Phaca megacarpa is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
